Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery krater; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of female figure to right with added white on flesh; dilute brown for hair tendrils; possible diadem on head; at right, horizontal strokes and dots belonging to undetermined object, e.g. wing or griffin.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1078)
